messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last 10 years, people have criticized many big supermarkets for doing bad things. For example, they have wasted a lot of food and paid their suppliers too little money. They have also created too much plastic waste with their packaging, which has harmed our environment. But now, supermarkets and food shops are starting to pay attention. Customers are very unhappy about the huge amount of plastic waste from packaging. Because of this, some of the largest supermarkets in the UK have made a promise. They plan to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The text uses multiple B2-level words which are not defined as keywords. 'Criticized', 'suppliers', 'packaging', and 'reduce' are all above the B1 level. This violates the vocabulary rule. Several sentences exceed the 15-word limit, and the text relies too heavily on the present perfect tense, making it structurally complex for a B1 learner.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: In the last 10 years, people said bad things about many big supermarkets. For example, they wasted a lot of food. They also paid the companies that sell them food too little money. They created too much plastic waste with the materials used to wrap food. This was bad for our environment. But now, supermarkets are starting to pay attention. Customers are very unhappy about the large amount of plastic waste. Because of this, some of the biggest UK supermarkets made a promise. They plan to change how they wrap food and create less plastic waste.

metadata.feedback_text: The text is a flawless example of B1 writing. It uses simple sentence structures, appropriate vocabulary, and accurately reflects the original text. All criteria are met without deviation.
